file_content.text: It's nice to get out of the office. Tharan looks so handsome in this light.
If anyone else tries intimidating my dear Tharan, you'll stop them, won't you?
That man just marched in, didn't even wipe his feet. So rude.
Be careful in the lower industrial sector. I still have to thank you for finding my Tharan.
Isn't Tharan just amazing?
Any sign of my Tharan yet? Please don't leave him out there.
Hello, and welcome to the offices of Doctor Tharan Cedrax! My name is Holiday, and I'm pleased to assist you!
If you have an appointment, please make yourself comfortable while--oh. Oh my goodness.
What a darling outfit! I must get Tharan to program me one just like it. Perhaps in a warmer shade, though.
I try to take care of myself. Nice to know it shows, even to a hologram.
You have good taste.
Oh no. A mere hologram would never have my eye for fashion.
It's rare to greet such a... distinguished customer. I'd save your picture to my permanent drive, but that might upset my dear Tharan.
Are you some sort of projection? Or a droid?
What exactly are you?
No, no, I'm more than that. Much more.
If Tharan can tear himself away from such a beautiful, um, person he deserves to be upset.
[Flirt] Do it anyway.
Mmm, very nice. But you lose points for the hesitation.
Is there an actual person on staff here?
Can I talk to somebody real?
Well, that just hurts my feelings. I do have feelings, you know.
I'm a fully sentient holographic life-form. Unique in the galaxy, or so Tharan says.
A soft image of a soft thing. Why bother with this, Herald?
You're a Jedi, aren't you? If you're here to see Tharan, he's... well, I've been waiting for him to get back. For hours and hours.
Did he tell you where he was going?
Where is he?
Perhaps he's delayed. Does he often just disappear?
Is that normal?
No, never. We can't bear to be apart, you see.
I imagine Nar Shaddaa's full of actual women to distract him.
Maybe he's on a date.
Trust me, sweetheart, I'm all the woman he'll ever need.
Tharan had a special order to design a weapon, and the customer wanted him to deliver the prototype to the Nikto Sector.
The aliens there hate humans, the Republic... hygiene. He should never have agreed to go.
Give me directions, and I'll bring him home safely for you, Holiday.
Just tell me where to look.
A Jedi can find anyone.
I promise, I'll be ever so grateful if you do.
I hope he doesn't get himself killed before I find him.
He'd better not be dead.
Oh, don't talk like that. What would I do without my Tharan?
The meeting place is in the Nikto Sector's starship chop shop. It sounds like a nasty place; please be careful.
Hello!
